intro: Calococcus sundaicus, commonly known as the Sunda calococcus, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, fuzzy leaves and showy, pink or red flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
